intro: Sloanea monosperma, commonly known as the yellow sloanea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, three-lobed fruits. It is often found in humid lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
